intro: Pseudopectinaria, commonly known as the false pectinaria, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, clustered flowers that often have a distinctive umbel shape. The leaves are usually finely divided, giving the plant a delicate appearance. It is native to regions of southern Europe and the Mediterranean, where it thrives in sunny, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
